title: COVID-19 Vaccine | Coronavirus | Allegheny Health Network
description: COVID-19 vaccines and boosters are now available to everyone. Get answers to your vaccine or booster questions and learn where to get them.
cleaned_text: There are currently several safe and effective vaccines for COVID-19 available through your doctor or pharmacy. You have two ways you can schedule your vaccination at AHN: You can also schedule your shot at a local pharmacy or retailer. Find a location near you using [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/). We have resources to answer your most common Coronavirus vaccine questions. Recommendations for vaccination vary based on your age, your health status, and the vaccine type you receive in your primary series. The Centers for Disease Control offers guidance based on your age and certain risk factors. Some people report symptoms like mild fever, headache, and body aches for a few days after receiving the vaccine. Learn some ways to prepare for feeling a bit under the weather if you do experience symptoms. There are multiple vaccine types for COVID-19 from different manufacturers. The method the vaccine uses to protect you from coronavirus can also vary between vaccines. Learn more about the different COVID-19 vaccine types: All available COVID-19 vaccines have met the Food and Drug Administration's strictest requirements for use in intended recipients based on age and certain risk factors. Find more answers on the CDC's website.
